content: I came across this request (https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-27906) but wanted to post out to the community as well: is there a requirement to support all levels of precision for a date search? We are looking at the Encounter date search and need to know if we are required to support fuzzy dates (year, year-month, etc.) in addition to the full precision we support today. Any clarity is greatly appreciated!

I don't think we've set clear expectations there. @Yunwei Wang - this seems like something that's at least tangentially related to the current MustSupport discussion. Can you add it to our list of discussion topics?
@Lloyd McKenzie For WGM or weekly call?

Thank you @Lloyd McKenzie & @Yunwei Wang - I saw the addition (https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FHIR+Infrastructure+Minutes+WGM+202009) but want to ensure I know what meeting this will be discussed this week: Today's (9/21/2020) FHIR-I meeting from 4-6pm EDT?
We'll discuss it briefly as part of an overall discussion on describing conformance capabilities at our 6-8pm Eastern call
This is the same class of problem as FHIR#27897 (Clarify Token Search Syntax) and FHIR#27905 (Clarify search by reference syntax)
Please let me know if this topic moved to a different agenda this week since we didn't get to it yesterday. Thank you!

Nevermind! I see the updated agenda for today @ 1400 - 1600. Thanks for keeping that up-to-date!
Okay - I was looking at the wrong JIRA so still looking for when this topic will be discussed. Thanks!

We may be able to tackle it towards the end of our 4pm-5:30 Eastern call. Though I expect that the outcome would be that this would be just another type of 'feature' - one that would be declared on CapabilityStatement.rest.resource.searchParam
